content.description: Great warmup for the more difficult and sustained slab routes. Careful not to wander too far right and put yourself in danger of taking a sign where the sun don't shine.
content.protection: One or two pads and a spotter.
content.location: When standing in the road, this problem is on the right side of the slabby part of this boulder.

content.description: This is a three move wonder, but it packs a punch. Start on the low, right facing side pull. Move up left to a "better-than-it-seems" pinch, up right to a skin-ruining crimp, and then dyno up left for the finishing jug to top out. This thing is short, but definitely quality. Get on it.
content.protection: one or two pads and a spotter
content.location: This is on the backside of the Fall Guys Boulder (the side that faces the Ice Cream Parlor).

content.description: This is the weakest of the three lines on this boulder (as far as I'm concerned). Smeary and short. There's a hold on this that looks vital, but it will surely blow if you use it. Think about staying left instead. Careful now...
content.protection: one or two pads and a spotter
content.location: This is dead center of the boulder on the side that faces the road.
